class_notes: (Also offered as IBS 547/548.) Location: Calhoun Auditorium (Emory Clinic). This course is for juniors, seniors, and graduate students who may be interested in a basic understanding of the eye. This course will review basic principles and state-of-the-art information on ocular anatomy, embryology, biochemistry, physiology, genetics, immunology, microbiology, pharmacology, and pathology. Prerequisites: Biology 142 and Biology 142L. This course ORIGINATES in the Department of OPHTHALMOLOGY (taught by Drs. Iuvone, Nickerson, and Boatright) and may be taken as elective credit for the biology major. This class will meet in the Calhoun Auditorium (Emory Clinic).
course_description: For juniors and seniors interested in a basic understanding of the eye. This course will review principles and state-of-the-art information on ocular anatomy, embryology, biochemistry, physiology, genetics, immunology, microbiology, pharmacology, and pathology.
